clubs.name: A-Crew
clubs.description: A-Crew is the combined groups, the Screamin' Eagles (SE) and the Eagle Bell Guard (BG), with the sole purpose to create and promote school spirit, encourage quality performance and high academic standards.  This is, not limited to development of spirit, leadership, cooperation, self-discipline, and sportsmanship in each individual member, through the student body and their community through support in the promotion of athletic events and activities which will inspire the athletes to perform to the best of their ability.

location.room: Allen High School Track and Field Stadium

clubs.name: Allen High School South Asian Cultural Association
Animation Club
clubs.description: It’s a great place to come together and appreciate art and animation! We have loads of fun by building up our art skills! We also have snacks! At the end of the month, we watch an animated film! Come learn some great tips on animation and just basic drawing! Bring your friends!

clubs.name: AHS Chess Club
clubs.description: We welcome all high school students to drop by and join us for friendly games of chess!

clubs.name: Community of International Baccalaureate Scholars
clubs.description: CIBS is an organization that brings together all AHS IB Full Diploma candidates for fellowship, support and encouragement. Our goal is to create interaction that will encourage each student's success in academics and beyond. Each CIBS meeting is designed around an activity that can be used as a CAS experience.

clubs.name: Cyber Security Club
clubs.description: Allen High School's Cyber Security Club's aim is to build interest in the cyber security field. By participating in various competitions such as CTFs and the AFA's CyberPatriot competition, the club motivates students to see the world from different perspectives as they find, exploit, and patch vulnerabilities. The Allen High School Cyber Security Club was founded by Mark Amirkan, Akshat Shah, and Reese Hoffart during their sophomore year at Allen High School (2019-2020 school year). They started by recruiting over 25 interested students from their school to participate in the Air Force Association's CyberPatriot program, the United States' largest cyber defense competition.

clubs.name: Daughters of Our Living Lord & Saviour
clubs.description: D.O.L.L.S. is a club created to reach out to teenagers during those awkward middle school and high school years and introduce them to the abundant life God promises his children.  Our goal is to teach students that they are, in fact, "true royalty" because they are children of the King.  For this reason, D.O.L.L.S. is an acronym that stands for "Daughters of Our Living Lord & Savior."

clubs.name: DECA
clubs.description: Allen DECA is a business, marketing, and hospitality and management organization designed for emerging leaders and entrepreneurs. Our goal is to guide or students to success through district, state, and international competitions based on their performance in DECA exams and presentations! Here at deca, We believe that all of our members are capable of success!
clubs.meeting: First Thursdays of the month, 2:45-3:30 PM

clubs.name: Digital Media Club
clubs.description: Digital Media Club is designated for people who like to create content using digital mediums. For example, creating digital art, videography, and graphic design.
clubs.leader: Haniyya Surayya, Afreeda Hossain, Angela Suresh

clubs.name: Eagle Edge
clubs.description: Student owned and operated spirit store

clubs.name: Eagle Tutors
clubs.description: Eagle Tutors is a student-run organization specializing in group and individual tutoring here at AHS! Our tutors are recommended by teachers at Allen High School for their academic accomplishments, outgoing nature, and friendly attitudes. If you need academic help, please reach out to us!

clubs.name: Environmental Club
clubs.description: Environmental Club's mission is to raise awareness among students and educate the community on the importance of sustainability, instill a sense of responsibility for the environment and a personal commitment to protect and preserve the environment, and educate/ cultivate an appreciation and interest in the environment. As a member of the club, the environmental ambassadors lead the environmental activities and events in school, identify and implement values based environmental programs within their school and community, and form part of the network to share and communicate their environmental activities and ideas.

clubs.name: eSports Club
clubs.description: The Allen High School eSports Club provides students a chance to compete in their favorite games. Students can join or create teams to build vital skills needed outside of school. Individual competition allows students to perform under pressure. Many eSports are represented by 60+ members and tournaments are constantly scheduled to allow consistent competition.

clubs.name: Fellowship of Christian Atheletes
clubs.description: The Fellowship of Christian Athletes is touching millions of lives... one heart at a time. Since 1954, the Fellowship of Christian Athletes has been challenging coaches and athletes on the professional, college, high school, junior high and youth levels to use the powerful medium of athletics to impact the world for Jesus Christ. FCA is the largest interdenominational, school-based, Christian sports organization in America. FCA focuses on serving local communities by equipping, empowering and encouraging people to make a difference for Christ

clubs.name: Gay-Straight Alliance
clubs.description: "Our goal is to make our school community safe and welcoming to all students regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity." You can make a difference! Join GSA and speak out against discrimination, intervene to help someone, or lend emotional support to others.

clubs.name: Health Occupational Students of America
clubs.description: HOSA is a national student organization endorsed by the U.S. Department of Education and the Health Science Education Division of ACTE. HOSA's two-fold mission is to promote career opportunities in the health care industry and to enhance the delivery of quality health care to all people.

clubs.name: Hispanic Heritage Awareness Club
clubs.description: Bring awareness to students who are not Hispanic, teach them about the culture and show them how special it is.

clubs.name: Jewish Student Union
clubs.description: Everyone interested in learning about Jewish Culture is invited. We’ll discuss and explore Jewish traditions and holidays, and meet and get to know our Jewish peers.

clubs.name: Junior World Affairs Council
clubs.description: JWAC/MUN students participate in Model United Nations simulations and learn about world crises, while at the same time honing their problem solving, public speaking, and negotiation skills. In the Junior World Affairs Council, students will attend various educational events featuring speakers knowledgeable in diplomatic matters. This club will give high-achieving and ambitious students many opportunities to change their world, from spreading awareness about world affairs to meeting other outstanding individuals.

clubs.name: Key Club
clubs.description: A volunteer organization dedicated to serving our home, school, and community.

clubs.name: Love and Art Club
clubs.description: Love and Art is a service organization dedicated to brightening up lives in the city of Allen through art. We visit nursing homes and organize events to give people a chance to express themselves creatively through art projects. There are many service clubs in Allen High School where the main purpose is to collect hours, but Love and Art focuses on the act of volunteering rather than the hours gained from it

clubs.name: National Arts Honor Society
clubs.description: The National Art Honor Society is an honorary group. Students must be invited to join NAHS. Qualifying students are invited based on a teacher recommendation through scholarship, attitude and attendance. The induction ceremony only happens once a year in December. Late applicants or transfer students have the opportunity to join the following year, should they meet the requirements. See any art teacher for more information on the NAHS!
clubs.meeting: 2nd or last Tuesday of the month, 4:15 PM

clubs.name: National Computer Science Honor Society
clubs.description: Club for programmers and people who are interested in technology

clubs.name: National Junior Honor Society
clubs.description: Freshman and Middle School version of National Honor Society

clubs.name: Nintendo Club
clubs.description: A club where students may come together to bond over their favorite Nintendo games & create a sort of friendly community

clubs.name: Open Computer Coding Competition
clubs.description: The OC3 is an opportunity for enthusiastic coders of any level to meet every other week for fun and excitement in a friendly competition with your peers. Everyone is invited; you do not need to be enrolled in any Computer Science course.

clubs.name: Peer Assistance and Leadership
clubs.description: Peer Assistance and Leadership (PAL) is a program in which 11th & 12th grade students develop leadership, communication and principle-based decision making skills, and set personal and professional goals.  PALs mentor individual students in K-9th grades, plan and participate in campus events and community service projects, welcome new AHS students, give campus tours to visitors, interview teacher/staff applicants.  PAL student-leaders undergo extensive peer-mentor training; learning to build trusting relationships with their PALees and understanding the guidelines of confidentiality.

clubs.name: Quill & Scroll National Honor Society
clubs.description: Allen High School's chapter of Quill and Scroll, the International Honorary Society of High School Journalists, continues as an active and vital part of Allen's journalism program. The Society, as a whole, has always taken an active part in raising journalistic standards and in directing the course of high school journalism. The purpose of the organization is to encourage and reward individual achievement in journalism and related fields.

clubs.name: Red Cross Eagles
clubs.description: Red Cross Eagles serves the AHS community by promoting health & safety, emergency preparedness and disease prevention. To the world, we make a difference by reducing human suffering and saving lives through volunteering, fundraising and blood services with the Red Cross of North Texas.

clubs.name: Science Honor Society
clubs.description: Our goal is to encourage and honor high school students who have a passion and aptitude for the sciences, and promote the application of science to help better our community. This society is available to juniors, seniors, and sophomores. To be eligible, all members must be currently enrolled in a science class. Juniors must have been enrolled in one honors science class before or in eleventh grade. Seniors must have been enrolled in two honors classes before or in twelfth grade. For a sophomore to be eligible, they must be enrolled in one AP level science class in 10th grade. All members must maintain a 3.00/4.00 GPA across all their classes, and a 3.00/4.00 across each science course. All members must attend at  least four general chapter meetings annually. All members must also participate in at least one of the chapter’s projects and complete at least five hours of science related service per semester. Members are to contribute to the organization’s purpose of spreading/implementing scientific awareness and thought through active discussions and science related service.

clubs.name: Scuba Club
clubs.description: Scuba Club is where students that love the ocean meet to become SCUBA Certified, continue their diving education with Advanced, Nitrox, and additional Certifications.  Scuba Club plans annual summer trips for our students and parents.
clubs.meeting: 1st and 3rd Wednesday of the month, 3:45-4:45 PM

clubs.name: Société Honoraire de Français
clubs.description: The French Club is a group of students who meet together on a cultural and social basis in order to provide an enriching extra-curricular student activity. Each meeting has a theme which can be based on holidays, events, and other culture hallmarks. Past meetings include Mardi Gras, Movie Night, Fashion Week, and Cirque du Soleil.

clubs.name: Spanish Honor Society
clubs.description: En la Sociedad Honoraria Hispánica, puedes mejorar tus habilidades de español e interactuar con otros estudiantes que comparten tu pasión por el idioma. Además, puedes practicar el idioma utilizando los tres modos comunicacionales (interpretativa, interpersonal y presentacional) y aprender más acerca de la cultura de los países hispanohablantes. ¡Únete al club para tener una experiencia única y divertida!

clubs.name: STEAM Ambassadors
clubs.description: Allen STEAM Ambassadors are 10th-12th grade students developing the communication, collaborative, and leadership skills necessary for future success in STEM/STEAM academic and professional endeavors. Ambassadors serve as STEAM advocates on campus and throughout the community as they assist in the continued development of programs offered at or through the Allen ISD STEAM Center.

clubs.name: STEAM Makerspace
clubs.description: Tutorials and resources for the STEAM Center Makerspace (CURRENTLY CLOSED)

clubs.name: STEAM Student Leadership
clubs.description: Allen STEAM Ambassadors are 10th-12th grade students developing the communication, collaborative, and leadership skills necessary for future success in STEM/STEAM academic and professional endeavors. Ambassadors serve as STEAM advocates on campus and throughout the community as they assist in the continued development of programs offered at or through the Allen ISD STEAM Center. STEAM Leadership takes STEAM Ambassadors to the next level, and serves as the 'core group' of this broader organization.

clubs.name: WINGS
clubs.description: W.I.N.G.S. is a program in which 10-12th grade students develop leadership, communication and principle-based decision making skills, and set personal and professional goals.  W.I.N.G.S. will plan and participate in campus-based service projects (Spirit Weeks, Charity Fundraisers, Red Ribbon Week, Be the One, Teacher Appreciation, etc), the Freshman Mentoring Program, welcome  new AHS students, mentor English Language Learners, and various community service projects.

clubs.name: AHS UIL Academics
clubs.description: If you have a skill in test taking and enjoy competition, UIL has a perfect contest just for you.  Contest information is subject-related and coaches are ready to help you prepare.  See Coaches List and Subject information.

location.room: Men's Lacrosse – Allen HS Practice Field

clubs.name: Young Asian Leaders of America
clubs.description: Young Asian Leaders of America is a nationally-based, non-profit organization, founded by and for youth, to cultivate the next generation of Asian American leaders, advocates, and allies in media, politics, and society.
clubs.meeting: Last Friday of the month, 4:00-5:00 PM

clubs.name: Young Life
clubs.description: Young Life is a world-class organization for adolescents. Our staff and volunteers enter the world of kids, focusing on what matters to them — fun, adventure, friendship and a sense of significance. In doing so, we earn the privilege of talking to them about something that we think matters most of all — the truth about God and His love for them.
